website_summaries.verdict: People generally like the Merrell Vapor Glove 4 and what it has to offer. This product is deemed versatile and accommodating, particularly to those who welcome a near-the-ground experience. The highlights include the flexible construction, the cool looks, and the effective gripping capacity. On the other hand, some have complained of fabrics that are prone to odor while others criticized the flimsy durability of the outsole.Fans of neutral running shoes that don’t have a lot of heft to its construction are likely to enjoy the Vapor Glove 4.
pros: Most consumers have welcomed the close-to-the-ground profile of the Merrell Vapor Glove 4
The flexibility of this product is lauded by testers
Several reviews emphasize the lightweight structure’s capacity to permit all-day wear
The traction equipped by the outsole unit is deemed reliable by a lot of purchasers
The aesthetics of this running shoe are appreciated, with some testers believing that the facade is great for casual walks
Fans of minimalist running shoes like the barefoot-like quality of their performances when wearing the Vapor Glove 4
The sole unit provides an excellent ground feel, according to a few users
A couple of purchasers have observed the upper material to dry quickly whenever they run in wet conditions
cons: Some runners have complained about the materials of the insole and the upper being susceptible to odor
The thinness of the underfoot platform paved the way for worn outsoles and holes, according to a few testers
A couple of wearers have noted the frontmost eyelet rubbed against the skin uncomfortably

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, light, nice looking, comfy. For me at least I think the sole is what I wanted. Not thick at all, you feel like walking barefoot, but thick enough to protect you from most annoying stuff.
customer_reviews.author: C A Snolind

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: They look a little like climbing shoes (which I don't hate actually) and the sole is thin enough to give a great representation of the ground. Fit is perfect (just took my usual shoe size) - snug around the foot and plenty of room in the toe box for me. I like the elastic laces. I still prefer five-fingers for a truly barefoot experience, but these are a very close second and more than enough of a compromise based on costs (or if the look of toes bother you!). I'll adjust if needed but these suit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Skinned alive
customer_reviews.text: It's possible to see what Merrell had in mind with this product, sort of. Imagine a walking or running shoe, minus any comfort, protection and support and this is what you get. Given the quanitiy of materials used to make them the profit margin must be, well, rather good. But I regret buying them, especially as the price dropped from £80 to £60 right after they were delivered. They come in quite a nice box, though, so that might be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Island Living

customer_reviews.title: Amazing trainers but not for me
customer_reviews.text: These are lovely trainers and are about the closest you can come to barefoot. Unfortunately for me I wear mine for everything including day to day and I didn’t quite like the look when they were on my feet. They still get 5 stars as they are probably the best true barefoot trainers and the colours were awesome!
customer_reviews.author: luke e.

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow and fits big
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, these are much narrower than the Glove 3, which I thought were perfect and allowed your foot to splay out naturally, whereas the 4 keeps your foot cramped in, so not good for me as a barefoot shoe. Secondly, these come up very big. I normally take a 8 to 8.5, but the 8.5 was like a clown's shoe and the 8 was just too big. A 7.5 was the perfect length but all the sizes were too narrow for me so had to send them back. Instead I want back to the Glove 3.
customer_reviews.author: Ramtin

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, light, good traction.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly comfortable. Very light. Lots of toe room. Great traction on grass, pavement, and track. Great colour. Shape looks funny. The cotton grey ones look really nice but are expensive and have much less traction. Good for long distance running as well as sprinting. Not water proof or resistant. Good for gym if you like a flat shoe when lifting. Been using them for a 3 months and I've never used a more comfortable shoe. You'll need to buy low socks for these.
customer_reviews.author: Mukhti

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing trail shoes, definitely for someone who is used to barefoot shoes and the outer sole is very thin, you will definitely feel every rock if you do use these for trails, which I do, so make sure you're used to and ready for 0 padding. I will definitely be buying these again when needed. They fort perfectly, so much foot movement but also very snug so you feel like you can run and jump around as much as you want.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Trebble

customer_reviews.title: A
customer_reviews.text: Light weight washable easy to get on and off yet offers stability and quite good traction good price
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These will change how you feel and walk. All for the better. Buy these for a better you. Bought these after trying a 44 in new Zealand. This was a size 43.5 and fits perfectly with a thinish sock. I'm normally a 44.5.
customer_reviews.author: Mr L G P Grossmith

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable barefoot shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I had been wearing a vivobarefoot shoe, these were hard on the feet. There does appear to be a little bit of give on the Merrell shoe and it makes the world of difference. I am happy to wear these all day and walk long distances with them. They are significantly more comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Pedronski

customer_reviews.title: A nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have been told that my posture is dreadful so these shoes were recommended to correct this problem. After a few weeks I feel better already.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Challis

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist but comfortable running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes if you're already into barefoot running and very comfortable to walk around in all day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Usually Merrell products are quite robust, unfortunately the tongue on one of the trainers has ripped away from the seam after only a few days wear.
customer_reviews.author: Garrus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent barefoot style shoe
customer_reviews.text: The fit on these was pretty much as expected size wise. I normally take anything between UK11 and UK12. I bought UK12 (Eur47) and they fit perfectly. I have the original Vapour Glove and these are also in size UK12. My feet are narrow and these are a good fit width wise, which possibly explains why some wider footed people are complaining about them not being as wide as the Vapour Glove 3. Having said that, the Vapour Glove 4 are noticeably wider than the original vapour glove.
customer_reviews.author: DisDave

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Vapor Glove 4 Fitness Shoes
feature_bullets: Mesh Upper- Allows air to penetrate the fabric for a cool, comfortable environment.
M-Select FRESH- Antimicrobial agents reduce shoe odour for a fresher for longer feeling.
Hyperlock TPU Film Heel Counter- Locked-in, secure feel.
Traditional Lace Up System- Adjustable fit for added security.
Moulded Nylon Arch Shank- Supportive structure diminishes load on feet and calves.
